t: For the director of music. According to sheminith. A psalm of David.
Help,*pn Lord,*s for no one is faithful anymore; those*ld who are loyal have vanished from the human race.
Everyone*ln lies to their neighbor; they*ld flatter with their lips but*ld harbor deception in their hearts.
May*pn the Lord*s silence all flattering lips and*ld every boastful tongue—
those*ln who say, “By*ld our tongues we will prevail; our*ld own lips will defend us—who is lord over us?”
“Because*pn the poor are plundered and the needy groan, I*ld will now arise,” says the Lord.*s “I*ld will protect them from those who malign them.”
And*ln the words of the Lord*s are flawless, like*ld silver purified in a crucible, like*ld gold refined seven times.
You,*pn Lord,*s will keep the needy safe and*ld will protect us forever from the wicked,
who*ln freely strut about when*ld what is vile is honored by the human race.
